entry.title: the only preface (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the only preface (book cover pictured) Jules Verne ever wrote was likely written by somebody else?

entry.title: Edward A. McGurk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edward A. McGurk disbanded the College of the Holy Cross's football team because he did not want it playing outside Worcester?

entry.title: Juventus U23 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Juventus's reserve team, Juventus U23, won their first trophy after only two years in existence?

entry.title: the Buffalo Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to promote the Buffalo Club, Rising Tide Records sent packages of plastic buffalo to music industry executives in Nashville?

entry.title: Carlos Alberto Sonnenschein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carlos Alberto Sonnenschein won three terms and spent twelve years in the Bolivian parliament despite barely attending any legislative sessions?

entry.title: Piri Reis map (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Piri Reis map likely contains the only surviving piece of an otherwise lost map of Christopher Columbus?

entry.title: Russ Winnie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to announce the first commercially broadcast Green Bay Packers game in 1929, Russ Winnie sat in a studio and read out telegrams sent from someone who was at the game?

entry.title: anomochilid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that depending on who you ask, an anomochilid could be a dwarf or a giant?
